poem:
The Misnomer  

Mistaken by a name,  
a gentle, fatal error,  
where hands that heal,  
mislaid in cloak of white.  

A body speaks in riddles,  
misheard amidst the rush—  
the heart beats silent,  
beneath the storm of titles.  

Leaves fall in quiet witness;   
beds empty  
like waiting rooms.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Coroner warns about NHS physician associates after misdiagnosis and death of woman A coroner has warned about the role of physician associates in NHS hospitals after a woman with severe abdominal problems was wrongly diagnosed as having a nosebleed and died four days later. The family of Pauline Marking, 77, were under the mistaken impression she had been seen by a doctor when she was examined in an emergency department, rather than a physician associate". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Coroner warns about NHS physician associates after misdiagnosis and death of woman A coroner has warned about the role of physician associates in NHS hospitals after a woman with severe abdominal problems was wrongly diagnosed as having a nosebleed and died four days later. The family of Pauline Marking, 77, were under the mistaken impression she had been seen by a doctor when she was examined in an emergency department, rather than a physician associate
